1.7.25  1:26 pm   I am learning the piano, which song or technique should I learn next?

      how about learning what the other instruments do

1.7.25  1:09 pm   what is your opinion on hexagons

      too easy

1.7.25  12:22 pm   is politics a game to win?

      yes, but you're only allowed to win half the time

1.7.25  12:04 pm   the frownage has begun :( :( :( :( :(

      that's fair

1.7.25  10:31 am   how do i become awesome

      awesome is only available as an unexpected side effect. for the main effect you'll need to aspire to something even better

1.7.25  8:46 am   what's your favourite day

      each day

1.7.25  7:03 am   how do you seem to never run out of different things to do with text!?!? like when i try to make something with text i always just run out of different effects and ways to show it to the viewer and yeah. how?

      if you think there are limited ways, then you can use that to your advantage. use all the ways at the same time. a person with infinite ways might not even be able to do that

1.7.25  5:20 am   what should i do if i keep making a new project, finish it quarter-half-way through and then give up because i have to make a new project, then the cycle repeats?

      this is the kind of thing that makes a person turn religious about finishing projects, which by extension also makes you turn religious about choosing them

1.7.25  4:10 am   so i'm having fun learning and practicing some pieces on piano, despite the mistakes. same with improv. but when it's time to perform for real (recording or live) and i make mistakes i feel like the worst piece of garbage in the multiverse. how to keep the practice mindset during real performance. so far i have recorded about 40 songs which are about 3 minutes long and i thought the feeling would get better, but it's actually getting worse

      i'm not following your logic. i think what you need is to get out of practice mindset, and into playing mindset. actually no, forget the mindset, just get into playing

1.7.25  3:44 am   opinions on bread?

      it's still not fully understood

1.7.25  12:51 am   You know what I like about roller coasters? Even if you're kinda hesitant to get on them, so long as you commit even the smallest amount of bravery to riding it, you pretty much conquer the entire thing by default. You get pushed through the line. They lock you into the seat. The ride literally forces you to move forward through the actual ups and downs of the experience. Screaming is encouraged! And once you're filled with all that sweet adrenaline you step onto solid ground knowing you beat the part of your brain that said you wouldn't be safe. You like 'em too Bill?

      no

1.6.25  11:35 pm   why do we spend so much money on exploring space when there is a whole unknown world right here on our own planet????

      both are being explored

1.6.25  10:13 pm   are you ever concerned that answering so many questions can be used by others to showcase any contradictions which you have made

      that's useful for everyone because we get to further explore how to improve communication all the way around

1.6.25  9:44 pm   Hey bill, wanna hear a joke?

      i'm still trying to unhear some jokes

1.6.25  9:28 pm   who invented gramatical errors

      you just did

1.6.25  9:16 pm   what's your favorite idea to thing about?

      i wonder if there is a first idea. i'd thing the heck out of that one, if someone else hasn't already

1.6.25  7:02 pm   do you ever plan on posting stuff that you've never shown before like a demo or sheet music/lyrics for an old song you won't record

      not under normal circumstances

1.6.25  5:41 pm   what do you think about tiles?

      they're gonna work

1.6.25  3:53 pm   How can you tell if a living being has a soul?

      honestly maybe it should be phrased the other way around

1.6.25  3:39 pm   How do you feel about Grover Cleaveland no longer being the only non-consecutive two term serving president? and how do you feel about Charles G. Dawes being the only vice-president to have a charting single to his name when his "melody in a major" got adapted into "it's all in the game" (and only Nobel prize winner before Bob Dylan won one)?

      i feel you should go into jeopardy auditions as soon as possible

1.6.25  12:24 pm   When do you think you became a professional musician? As in, when do you think you realized that you would make a career out of music?

      i always knew it would be much more than just a profession. and yet still only part of the big picture

1.6.25  10:26 am   Protest music was a big part of the culture of the 1960s. Why doesn't this seem to be the case today despite many parallels between our two times?

      it's possible that everything is so insular that you're just not looking in the right place

1.6.25  8:53 am   I accidentally tripped and time started going backwards 

      so which happened first then

1.6.25  6:31 am   I cut myself and found out I have neon green blood. Why is this?

      it's probably part of a movie marketing campaign

1.6.25  6:27 am   have you ever had to look up lyrics without the music? and do you imagine the song in your head when you do it

      there is no source to look up lyrics. all the general internet lyric resources seem to be wrong on purpose. there's no other explanation for how wrong they are

1.6.25  4:43 am   Can I please have some reassurance?

      that reminds me of the person just the other day who asked me if if i could help them with

1.6.25  3:29 am   would you say that there's a deeper meaning to your songs?

      that reminds me of the person just the other day who asked me if the object they were holding is heavier

1.6.25  2:50 am   What do I do when I hesitate to a point that I'm afraid I'm literally never going to start?

      honestly just add like the 2 or 3 missing words at the end of what you just said, and you're pretty much there

1.6.25  1:59 am   todays my birthday, but the capital rioters hijacked the image of jan 6th. what should I do to steal it back for myself

      i need some strategies too. i wrote a really great verse for a song in 2020 that happens to reference the date of january 6th, having no idea that that date would soon be cursed harder than adolf hitler and 9 11 combined. i've been struggling ever since to find a way to patch that. other dates just don't ring the same, have to find a totally new way around that line, thanks hitler

1.6.25  1:38 am   how do i increase my productivity while sitting in my bedroom working on my computer? i guess the only REALLY rigid requirement is that i still need to access my computer for the projects i'm working on, but it just feels too laid back and unstructured and i can do whatever, access whatever, and i end up spending houuuuurs not working or doing anything remotely productive towards my goals. thoughts? does going to work in a public space (library) help, or maybe just locking my computer down so much that i can't access anything? i feel like i need to trick myself into being productive, because it's the only way i've ever managed to do it before (tricking myself into believing a schedule has actual pressure, tricking myself into using todo lists, etc). the problem is that my brain will 100% of the time EVENTUALLY see through the trick, and it'll stop working. so i feel like i need something material. it feels pretty grim, though, because i've been having this issue for literal years now, and my life is just ticking on by. so..... if you've got any advice it'd be much appreciated. thanks

      at the risk of saying the same thing i say over and over and over and over and over and over and over again, it seems glaringly obvious that there is a huge missing variable in this equation. you're talking all about whether or not you're able to do the _____, when you might try to do the _____, how to stop being distracted with things other than the _____ ........ forgive me but the whole solution is what goes in that blank and W.H.A.T. it is and learning everything about it. The kind of fun thing about this is to think about this 'what' issue at any time. chew away at 'what exactly is this', you can think about this while you're in bed, when you are waiting in line for the other line you have to wait in, these are the best times to just get curious about exactly what this whole thing is and why it ever was so exciting. everything else becomes such a non-issue compared to the this 'what' question, sorry for repeating myself and sorry also about when i explain it again soon

1.6.25  12:59 am   I bet you studied etymology, Bill.

Am I wrong?

      you said that as if i don't anymore. i mean heck the most exciting discoveries must be still ahead

1.5.25  11:42 pm   what's your favorite game console?

      they are all the best and worst. i was gonna say the first one i played is best, but no, that one is the best and worst. it all adds up

1.5.25  11:07 pm   am I speaking to the correct bill wurtz at this moment in time

      y.e.s. which stands for yes extremely surely

1.5.25  8:21 pm   do you like playing along?

      not quite

1.5.25  8:17 pm   How to start doing a thing

      there are 2 ways. 1. what thing. and 2. you already started it and didn't know what the thing was or that you started it but now you know both. The way you approached the scenario is maybe the only way that doesn't work

1.5.25  7:35 pm   how to pull a rabbit out of a hat

      that's easy, you just have to stop the clock at an odd number of planck units

1.5.25  7:08 pm   why are they called red cabbage and red onions when they are clearly purple?

      to keep the conversation going, and fuel the perpetual marketing machine

1.5.25  6:55 pm   is it bad to yearn

      no

1.5.25  5:52 pm   Why do humans want to set up rules for themselves and then get an immeasurable desire to break them?

      have you ever tried doing none of that for a long period of time

1.5.25  5:40 pm   how do you feel about that gnarly c and c# business that happens in 'here there and everywhere'. where the melody picks out Cs over F#min7. i never noticed it before. intuitively i would have thought that chord would be Esus4/F# but no

      this may not be a popular answer, but i think you know what you're doing a little better than they (he?) did in that particular moment. i mean they got away with it, but it would only be stronger if it had just gone the way you've just prescribed, let's be honest

1.5.25  3:27 pm   a flower can't watch itself wilt

      ok but can it watch itself grow

1.5.25  2:18 pm   im about to play bass in all state jazz band but i am so scared bill do you have any advice to be less scared

      yep, play in bands all the time, as part of your everyday life. whether or not that's what you wanted to hear, this is precisely the exact and only solution to this problem

1.5.25  1:03 pm   Dreams really are strange things, aren't they?
Do you recall any you recently had that you feel like sharing?

      i dreamed i was awake, but i suppose that's pretty standard

1.5.25  12:34 pm   are you a wet blanket

      i am in fact a very dry blanket

1.5.25  9:57 am   Should we invent a new grammatical article?

      only if you need it. if you don't need it, then i'd technically just consider that an arts&crafts project

1.5.25  8:23 am   can you pull a hat out of a rabbit

      sure i'd be glad to do that for you

1.5.25  5:52 am   Are you the kind of person to make a new year's resolution?

      let me.............. think

1.5.25  4:54 am   will you release an autobiography in the form of the world's longest song? (you should)

      no that doesn't make any sense to me

1.5.25  4:53 am   fave epic moment?

      how about this one

1.5.25  4:10 am   How do you always give the most unexpected answers that end up being right anyways?

      perhaps i'm always wrong
